intro: Clidemia heteromalla, commonly known as velvetleaf or false mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its velvety, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Clidemia heteromalla is often found in moist, shaded areas and can be invasive in certain regions.
